Using the Squiggle API

Source: vignettes/using-squiggle-api.Rmd
using-squiggle-api.Rmd
library(fitzRoy)
library(dplyr)

Squiggle Data

You can access data from the Squiggle API directly with the fetch_squiggle_data. This allows direct access to the Squiggle API.

Note that we also provide some helper functions that map more closely to our fetch_ functions such as fetch_ladder_squiggle.

Queries

Full instructions for constructing queries can be found at Squiggle API. One of the following must be provided to the query argument.

  • teams - Info about teams (e.g. Richmond, Geelong, West Coast)
  • games - Info about games (e.g. Round 1, 2019 Richmond v Carlton)
  • sources - Info about models (e.g. Matter of Stats, GRAFT, Swinburne)
  • tips - Info about tips and predictions made by models
  • standings - Info about team standings (i.e. the ladder)
  • ladder - Info about predicted ladders generated by models
  • virtual - Info about Virtually Season 2020
  • pav - Info about Player Approximate Value from HPN Footy

Optional Arguments

Optional arguments can then be supplied based on the query.

For example, games takes the following optional arguments. * year - Year * round - Round * game - Game ID * complete - Percent of game complete

These can be supplied as named arguments after the query. For example, to return games from just 2020, we would use the following.

fetch_squiggle_data(query = "games", year = 2020)
#> # A tibble: 162 × 24
#>    ateamid winner hteamid is_grand_final roundname venue round complete abehinds
#>      <int> <chr>    <int>          <int> <chr>     <chr> <int>    <int>    <int>
#>  1      16 Sydney       1              0 Round 1   Adel…     1      100        8
#>  2       6 Essen…       5              0 Round 1   Dock…     1      100        9
#>  3      13 Port …       8              0 Round 1   Carr…     1      100       16
#>  4       7 Great…       9              0 Round 1   Sydn…     1      100        7
#>  5       2 Hawth…      10              0 Round 1   M.C.…     1      100        8
#>  6      15 North…      12              0 Round 1   Dock…     1      100       12
#>  7       3 Richm…      14              0 Round 1   M.C.…     1      100        9
#>  8      11 West …      17              0 Round 1   Pert…     1      100        9
#>  9       4 Colli…      18              0 Round 1   Dock…     1      100        8
#> 10       6 Brisb…       2              0 Round 2   Gabba     2      100        9
#> # … with 152 more rows, and 15 more variables: localtime <chr>, hbehinds <int>,
#> #   date <chr>, is_final <int>, hgoals <int>, year <int>, hscore <int>,
#> #   hteam <chr>, ascore <int>, tz <chr>, ateam <chr>, agoals <int>,
#> #   updated <chr>, winnerteamid <int>, id <int>

Examples

Teams

Fetch info about one or more AFL teams.

fetch_squiggle_data("teams")
#> # A tibble: 18 × 4
#>    abbrev logo                                              id name             
#>    <chr>  <chr>                                          <int> <chr>            
#>  1 ADE    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Ade…     1 Adelaide         
#>  2 BRI    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Bri…     2 Brisbane Lions   
#>  3 CAR    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Car…     3 Carlton          
#>  4 COL    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Col…     4 Collingwood      
#>  5 ESS    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Ess…     5 Essendon         
#>  6 FRE    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Fre…     6 Fremantle        
#>  7 GEE    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Gee…     7 Geelong          
#>  8 GC     /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Gol…     8 Gold Coast       
#>  9 GWS    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Gia…     9 Greater Western …
#> 10 HAW    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Haw…    10 Hawthorn         
#> 11 MEL    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Mel…    11 Melbourne        
#> 12 NOR    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Nor…    12 North Melbourne  
#> 13 POR    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Por…    13 Port Adelaide    
#> 14 RIC    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Ric…    14 Richmond         
#> 15 STK    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/StK…    15 St Kilda         
#> 16 SYD    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Syd…    16 Sydney           
#> 17 WCE    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Wes…    17 West Coast       
#> 18 WBD    /wp-content/themes/squiggle/assets/images/Bul…    18 Western Bulldogs

Games

Fetch info about one or more games.

fetch_squiggle_data(query = "games", year = 2020)
#> # A tibble: 162 × 24
#>    ateamid winner hteamid is_grand_final roundname venue round complete abehinds
#>      <int> <chr>    <int>          <int> <chr>     <chr> <int>    <int>    <int>
#>  1      16 Sydney       1              0 Round 1   Adel…     1      100        8
#>  2       6 Essen…       5              0 Round 1   Dock…     1      100        9
#>  3      13 Port …       8              0 Round 1   Carr…     1      100       16
#>  4       7 Great…       9              0 Round 1   Sydn…     1      100        7
#>  5       2 Hawth…      10              0 Round 1   M.C.…     1      100        8
#>  6      15 North…      12              0 Round 1   Dock…     1      100       12
#>  7       3 Richm…      14              0 Round 1   M.C.…     1      100        9
#>  8      11 West …      17              0 Round 1   Pert…     1      100        9
#>  9       4 Colli…      18              0 Round 1   Dock…     1      100        8
#> 10       6 Brisb…       2              0 Round 2   Gabba     2      100        9
#> # … with 152 more rows, and 15 more variables: localtime <chr>, hbehinds <int>,
#> #   date <chr>, is_final <int>, hgoals <int>, year <int>, hscore <int>,
#> #   hteam <chr>, ascore <int>, tz <chr>, ateam <chr>, agoals <int>,
#> #   updated <chr>, winnerteamid <int>, id <int>

Sources

Fetch info about one or more computer models.

# You can get the sources
fetch_squiggle_data("sources")
#> # A tibble: 25 × 4
#>       id url                                   name            icon             
#>    <int> <chr>                                 <chr>           <chr>            
#>  1     1 "https://live.squiggle.com.au/"       Squiggle        "/wp-content/upl…
#>  2     2 "https://thearcfooty.com/"            The Arc         "/wp-content/the…
#>  3     3 "http://figuringfooty.com/"           Figuring Footy  "/wp-content/the…
#>  4     4 "http://www.matterofstats.com/"       Matter of Stats "/wp-content/the…
#>  5     5 ""                                    Punters         ""               
#>  6     6 "https://footymaths.blogspot.com"     FMI             "/wp-content/the…
#>  7     7 "http://plussixoneblog.com/"          PlusSixOne      "/wp-content/the…
#>  8     8 "/introducing-s10/"                   Aggregate       ""               
#>  9     9 "http://graftratings.com/afl/"        Graft           "/wp-content/the…
#> 10    10 "https://stattraction.wordpress.com/" Stattraction    "/wp-content/the…
#> # … with 15 more rows

Tips

Fetch info about one or more tips made by computer models.

# Get all tips
fetch_squiggle_data("tips")
#> # A tibble: 14,848 × 21
#>     year hmargin    bits   err ateamid hteam       tipteamid ateam  tip   source
#>    <int>   <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>   <int> <chr>           <int> <chr>  <chr> <chr> 
#>  1  2017   -1     0      42         14 Carlton            14 Richm… Rich… Squig…
#>  2  2017   NA     0.214  NA         14 Carlton            14 Richm… Rich… Figur…
#>  3  2017    5.39 -0.208  48.4       14 Carlton             3 Richm… Carl… Matte…
#>  4  2017  -10.3   0.326   3.69      18 Collingwood        18 Weste… West… Matte…
#>  5  2017  -17     0.310   3         18 Collingwood        18 Weste… West… Squig…
#>  6  2017    3     0      53          9 Adelaide            1 Great… Adel… Squig…
#>  7  2017   -8     0.234  35         14 Carlton            14 Richm… Rich… The A…
#>  8  2017  -13     0.358   1         18 Collingwood        18 Weste… West… The A…
#>  9  2017    2    -0.0862 32         11 St Kilda           15 Melbo… St K… The A…
#> 10  2017   29    -1.28   57         13 Sydney             16 Port … Sydn… The A…
#> # … with 14,838 more rows, and 11 more variables: correct <int>, hteamid <int>,
#> #   updated <chr>, sourceid <int>, round <int>, venue <chr>, confidence <dbl>,
#> #   gameid <int>, hconfidence <dbl>, date <chr>, margin <dbl>

We can just look at one particular round.

# Get` just tips from round 1, 2018
fetch_squiggle_data("tips", round = 1, year = 2018)
#> # A tibble: 126 × 21
#>     year hmargin    bits   err ateamid hteam    tipteamid ateam   tip     source
#>    <int>   <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>   <int> <chr>        <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr> 
#>  1  2018    NA    0.675   NA         3 Richmond        14 Carlton Richmo… Punte…
#>  2  2018    NA    0.0588  NA         1 Essendon         5 Adelai… Essend… Punte…
#>  3  2018    NA    0.521   NA         2 St Kilda        15 Brisba… St Kil… Punte…
#>  4  2018    NA    0.666   NA         6 Port Ad…        13 Freman… Port A… Punte…
#>  5  2018    NA   -0.0151  NA        12 Gold Co…        12 North … North … Punte…
#>  6  2018    NA    0.122   NA         4 Hawthorn        10 Collin… Hawtho… Punte…
#>  7  2018    NA    0.530   NA        18 Greater…         9 Wester… Greate… Punte…
#>  8  2018    NA   -0.198   NA         7 Melbour…        11 Geelong Melbou… Punte…
#>  9  2018    NA    0.486   NA        16 West Co…        16 Sydney  Sydney  Punte…
#> 10  2018    35.2  0.674    9.2       3 Richmond        14 Carlton Richmo… Aggre…
#> # … with 116 more rows, and 11 more variables: correct <int>, hteamid <int>,
#> #   updated <chr>, sourceid <int>, round <int>, venue <chr>, confidence <dbl>,
#> #   gameid <int>, hconfidence <dbl>, date <chr>, margin <dbl>

Standings

Fetch info about team standings at a point in time, i.e. the ladder.

fetch_squiggle_data("standings", year = 2020, round = 1)
#> # A tibble: 18 × 15
#>    percentage   pts  for. name           against losses  wins    id draws played
#>         <dbl> <int> <int> <chr>            <int>  <int> <int> <int> <int>  <int>
#>  1      262.      4    76 Port Adelaide       29      0     1    13     0      1
#>  2      253.      4    86 Collingwood         34      0     1     4     0      1
#>  3      153.      4    78 West Coast          51      0     1    17     0      1
#>  4      145.      4    90 Hawthorn            62      0     1    10     0      1
#>  5      144.      4   105 Greater Weste…      73      0     1     9     0      1
#>  6      130.      4   105 Richmond            81      0     1    14     0      1
#>  7      111.      4    63 Essendon            57      0     1     5     0      1
#>  8      104.      4    74 Sydney              71      0     1    16     0      1
#>  9      104.      4    56 North Melbour…      54      0     1    12     0      1
#> 10       96.4     0    54 St Kilda            56      1     0    15     0      1
#> 11       95.9     0    71 Adelaide            74      1     0     1     0      1
#> 12       90.5     0    57 Fremantle           63      1     0     6     0      1
#> 13       77.1     0    81 Carlton            105      1     0     3     0      1
#> 14       69.5     0    73 Geelong            105      1     0     7     0      1
#> 15       68.9     0    62 Brisbane Lions      90      1     0     2     0      1
#> 16       65.4     0    51 Melbourne           78      1     0    11     0      1
#> 17       39.5     0    34 Western Bulld…      86      1     0    18     0      1
#> 18       38.2     0    29 Gold Coast          76      1     0     8     0      1
#> # … with 5 more variables: goals_for <int>, behinds_against <int>,
#> #   behinds_for <int>, rank <int>, goals_against <int>

Ladder

Fetch info about one or more projected ladders generated by computer models. For the actual ladder, see standings instead.

fetch_squiggle_data("ladder", year = 2019, round = 15, source = 1)
#> # A tibble: 18 × 12
#>    teamid team  swarms  rank round sourceid updated  wins mean_rank  year source
#>     <int> <chr> <chr>  <int> <int>    <int> <chr>   <dbl>     <dbl> <int> <chr> 
#>  1      1 Adel… "c(\"…     6    15        1 2019-0…  12.7      6.11  2019 Squig…
#>  2      2 Bris… "c(\"…     5    15        1 2019-0…  13        6.01  2019 Squig…
#>  3      3 Carl… "c(\"…    17    15        1 2019-0…   6.1     16.7   2019 Squig…
#>  4      4 Coll… "c(\"…     4    15        1 2019-0…  14.1      4.20  2019 Squig…
#>  5      5 Esse… "c(\"…    10    15        1 2019-0…  10.8      9.98  2019 Squig…
#>  6      6 Frem… "c(\"…     9    15        1 2019-0…  10.8      9.71  2019 Squig…
#>  7      7 Geel… "c(\"…     1    15        1 2019-0…  17.3      1.21  2019 Squig…
#>  8      8 Gold… "c(\"…    18    15        1 2019-0…   4.9     17.7   2019 Squig…
#>  9      9 Grea… "c(\"…     2    15        1 2019-0…  14.4      3.26  2019 Squig…
#> 10     10 Hawt… "c(\"…    14    15        1 2019-0…   8.8     13.0   2019 Squig…
#> 11     11 Melb… "c(\"…    16    15        1 2019-0…   8       14.8   2019 Squig…
#> 12     12 Nort… "c(\"…    11    15        1 2019-0…  10.2     10.9   2019 Squig…
#> 13     13 Port… "c(\"…     8    15        1 2019-0…  11.5      8.24  2019 Squig…
#> 14     14 Rich… "c(\"…     7    15        1 2019-0…  12.8      6.67  2019 Squig…
#> 15     15 St K… "c(\"…    15    15        1 2019-0…   9       13.8   2019 Squig…
#> 16     16 Sydn… "c(\"…    13    15        1 2019-0…   9.2     12.9   2019 Squig…
#> 17     17 West… "c(\"…     3    15        1 2019-0…  14.4      4.16  2019 Squig…
#> 18     18 West… "c(\"…    12    15        1 2019-0…   9.8     11.9   2019 Squig…
#> # … with 1 more variable: percentage <dbl>

PAV

Fetch info about players using HPN Footy’s Player Approximate Value.

fetch_squiggle_data("pav", 
                    firstname = "Dustin", 
                    surname = "Martin", 
                    year = 2017)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 21
#>   PAV_def PAV_total_rank mPAV_mid  team PAV_def_rank mPAV_off mPAV_rank
#>     <dbl>          <int>    <dbl> <int>        <int>    <dbl>     <int>
#> 1    2.69              2     2.06    14          253     1.24         2
#> # … with 14 more variables: firstname <chr>, mPAV_total <dbl>,
#> #   X._of_team_games <dbl>, PAV_total <dbl>, PAV_mid_rank <int>, year <int>,
#> #   PAV_off_rank <int>, pavid <int>, name <chr>, games <int>, PAV_mid <dbl>,
#> #   surname <chr>, PAV_off <dbl>, mPAV_def <dbl>
